Module Basics
Package basics.math.downhill

Interface DownhillFunction

All Known Implementing Classes:
InversePosFunction
public interface DownhillFunction
Abstract function that can be minimized using the Downhill class.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int dimensions()
    Number of dimensions for function arguments.
    double[] initialArgument()
    Initial argument to start to find the minimum.
    double[] initialSimplexDelta()
    For each argument dimension provide the size of the inital simplex.
    double[] mapToArgument​(double[] x)
    Map an argument to an argument in the definition set.
    boolean minimumReached​(double[] x, double value)
    Decide if a pair of x, f(x) is close enough to the minimum.
    double value​(double[] x, java.lang.Object[] userData)
    Function to minimize, provides a function value f(x) for a given argument x.

  • Method Details

    • dimensions

      int dimensions()
      Number of dimensions for function arguments.
      Returns:
      number of dimensions

    • initialArgument

      double[] initialArgument()
      Initial argument to start to find the minimum.
      Returns:
      initial argument

    • initialSimplexDelta

      double[] initialSimplexDelta()
      For each argument dimension provide the size of the inital simplex.
      Returns:
      initial simplex delta

    • mapToArgument

      double[] mapToArgument​(double[] x)
      Map an argument to an argument in the definition set. This means, if a certain x[i] is not in the allowed limit, it is mapped to the nearest allowed value.
      Parameters:
      x - argument
      Returns:
      argument in the definition set, may be x, if x is in the definition set

    • value

      double value​(double[] x, java.lang.Object[] userData)
      Function to minimize, provides a function value f(x) for a given argument x.
      Parameters:
      x - argument
      userData - the caller may pass an Object[1] and the function may store any data here that later is related to the minimum value
      Returns:
      f(x)

    • minimumReached

      boolean minimumReached​(double[] x, double value)
      Decide if a pair of x, f(x) is close enough to the minimum.
      Parameters:
      x - argument
      value - f(x)
      Returns:
      true if close enough
